title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: N.H. House passed the CHARLIE Act, restricting teachings on race and LGBTQ+ issues in public schools, on a 184–164 vote.
The bill, named after activist Charlie Kirk, bars instruction promoting division and certain academic frameworks, including critical race theory.
Violations of the bill could lead to educator discipline or lawsuits against schools for up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are created using food coloring, a local tradition for decades.
The Hairpin Turn offers panoramic views of Hoosac Valley and Mount Greylock, attracting many visitors in winter.
Nearby attractions include the Golden Eagle Restaurant and the MASS MoCA art museum, 3 miles from the icicles.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms its first two measles cases of 2026, involving a school-aged child and an adult from Greater Boston.
The Greater Boston adult had recently returned from abroad with uncertain vaccination history and visited multiple public locations while infectious.
Despite these cases, Massachusetts health officials emphasize that high vaccination rates keep the overall risk low for residents.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident, passed away on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
Morgan, a mother of two, was known for her work at Boston's Inspectional Services, where she earned the nickname 'Hollywood'.
Visiting hours will be held March 3 at George F. Doherty & Sons, with a funeral mass on March 4 at St. Mary of the Assumption Church.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor her late father and raise awareness for ALS.
Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, Florida, lost her father to ALS and is inspired by his kindness and community dedication.
The marathon represents hope for a future where ALS patients have better treatment options and outcomes.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion with the Supreme Judicial Court over audit lawsuit disputes.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell seeks to strike DiZoglio's lawsuit, citing violation of separation of powers.
DiZoglio requests a special assistant attorney general due to alleged conflict of interest by AG Campbell.

title: This speech-language therapist is running Boston to fund autism support services
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Carrie Kerstein, 40, from Cambridge, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the Doug Flutie Jr. Foundation for Autism.
Kerstein, a pediatric speech-language therapist, aims to support autism services and spread understanding and acceptance.
She combines her passion for running with her professional work to empower autistic individuals and their families.

title: The City of Boston handed residents $2.2M to decide funding. Here’s what they picked.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston residents allocated $2.2 million for projects including immigrant legal defense and food access through a participatory budgeting initiative.
Over 4,800 voted on proposals for initiatives such as housing stability, workforce training, and youth financial literacy in January-February.
Winning projects receive funding this spring; city departments, led by the Office of Participatory Budgeting, will oversee implementation.

title: Someone allegedly struck her ex’s new girlfriend with a car in Newton. Now both women are facing charges.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Rosa Sanchez, 37, allegedly tried to kill her ex's new girlfriend, Esneiry Pimentel-Lugo, 22, by striking her with a car in Newton.
The confrontation escalated from a physical fight to Sanchez allegedly driving her car onto the curb to hit Pimentel-Lugo.
Both women faced charges of assault with a dangerous weapon and were released on personal recognizance; they will appear in court March 23.

title: Two Boston startups join the race to create the next major weight-loss drug
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Vivtex partnered with Novo Nordisk to develop oral obesity and diabetes drugs, potentially earning $2.1 billion in royalties.
Nimbus Therapeutics and Eli Lilly are collaborating on oral obesity treatments, with a partnership valued at up to $1.3 billion.
Vivtex's 'GI tract on a chip' and Nimbus's computer modeling target the rising GLP-1 drug market for weight loss.
